meanings.definition: To give a particular style or design to something.
meanings.sent1: She likes to stylise her outfits with colorful accessories.
meanings.sent2: Artists often stylise their paintings to express their unique vision.
meanings.sent3: He tried to stylise his lunch by arranging the food in a fancy pattern.
meanings.sent4: The interior designer managed to stylise the room into a cozy retreat.
meanings.sent5: The hairstylist can stylise any hair type with skill and creativity.

meanings.definition: To make something conform to a particular style.
meanings.sent1: The decorator will stylise the room according to the client's preferences.
meanings.sent2: It is important to stylise the website to match the company's branding.
meanings.sent3: She decided to stylise her speech to sound more formal and professional.
meanings.sent4: The tailor can stylise any garment to fit perfectly and look stylish.
meanings.sent5: The chef will stylise the dish presentation for a more elegant dining experience.
